Package gw.cc.financials.check.entity

Interface CheckSet

All Superinterfaces:
TransactionSet
public interface CheckSet extends TransactionSet
CheckSet A check submitted for approval.

  • Method Details

    • newCheckCreator

      CheckCreator newCheckCreator(Exposure exposure)
      Returns a new CheckCreator object for creating a check on this checkSet.
      Parameters:
      exposure - Exposure of the check, could be null, then the CheckCreator will be created with current checkSet's claim

    • updateServicePeriods

      void updateServicePeriods(boolean updateAll)
      Updates the service periods for the recurring checks in this checkset.

    • getPrimaryCheck

      Check getPrimaryCheck()
      Gets the primary check with the earliest scheduled send date from this CheckSet. If there are no primary checks, gets an arbitrary check. Returns null if there are no checks.
      Returns:
      the first primary check (by scheduled send date) of this CheckSet, or an arbitrary check if none of the checks are primary checks, or null if there are no checks

    • getPaymentsAmount

      BigDecimal getPaymentsAmount()
      The sum of all payments in this CheckSet, in the Check currency. All Checks in a CheckSet have the same currency, which can be accessed as checkSet.PrimaryCheck.Currency

    • getPrimaryChecksSortedByDate

      Check[] getPrimaryChecksSortedByDate()
      The primary checks in this CheckSet sorted by scheduled send date (ascending).

    • getFirstEditableCheckGroup

      CheckGroup getFirstEditableCheckGroup()
      Returns the first editable check group. In certain cases the earliest check group is not editable. This provides the UI with the most appropriate check group for modification.
      Returns:
      the first CheckGroup in this CheckSet for which isEditable() returns TRUE

    • isRecurring

      boolean isRecurring()
      True if this CheckSet is a recurring CheckSet.

    • isForBulkedCheck

      boolean isForBulkedCheck()
      Tests whether this CheckSet is for a bulked check (i.e., contains one and only one check, which is also associated with a BulkInvoiceItem).
      Returns:
      true if this CheckSet is for a bulked check, else returns false

    • resetCheckAndPaymentsToDraft

      void resetCheckAndPaymentsToDraft()
      Loop through the checks to reset all of them and its payments back to draft and its CheckSet back to unapproved state. Its intended use is in configurations where you want to set the CheckSet for approval again, once changes are made to some extension fields.

    • prepareForCommit

      ApprovalResult prepareForCommit() throws com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.WorkflowValidationException
      Prepares the previously created check for commit to the database. Call this method after calling resetCheckAndPaymentsToDraft() and performing any modifications to the check, such as adding additional Payments or TransactionLineItems. This methods executes PreSetup Rules, updates TAccounts and also submits the check for approval. If approval is required, an approval activity will be created. Otherwise, the CheckSet will automatically be marked as approved.

      This method is intended to be used only from within Rules, where you will use them to commit modifications made to an already submitted check.

      IMPORTANT:

      • After calling this method, the check may not be modified, except for extension fields.
      • This method should not be called on recurring checks, as programmatic editing of recurring checks is currently not supported. Attempting to do so will result in an appropriate exception being thrown.
      Returns:
      an ApprovalResult object, representing the result of the approval
      Throws:
      com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.WorkflowValidationException

    • isExceedsAvailableReserves

      boolean isExceedsAvailableReserves()
      check if checkSet transactions exceeds available reserves. Can be used in rules regardless of approval status or other status changes.
      Returns:
      true if all transactions exceeds available reserves

    • getPrimaryEditableCheck

      Check getPrimaryEditableCheck()
      Returns the earliest check, according to ScheduledSendDate, that is both primary and editable. For use when editing a recurring check, in case the first checks in the list have already been escalated.
      Returns:
      The earliest editable primary Check in the CheckSet
